main event: A military pilot and observer spotted an unidentified bright white object with a tail that appeared to be a meteor-like object descending from the sky over Luke AFB, Arizona on December 15, 1954.
interesting points: The object appeared as a bright white light that descended towards the observers, gaining intensity and apparent speed with a tail forming as it fell.
The object eventually burned out and broke apart, dulling to an orange color.
The pilots were flying an F-121 aircraft at the time of the sighting.
Weather conditions at the time included an overcast sky and varying wind speeds and temperatures at different altitudes.
The report indicates that other unidentified objects were detected in the area by the Phoenix Air Defense Sector around the same time.
result: Inconclusive, possibly a satellite decay or meteor-like object
sighted object: A bright white object with a tail, appearing to be a meteor-like object
